Caesarean section in a patient with haemoglobin SC disease and a phaeochromocytoma.
 The anaesthetic management of a patient with haemoglobin SC disease for lower segment Caesarean section and excision of a phaeochromocytoma is described.
 The patient was given a general anaesthetic for the surgical procedure after exchange transfusion had achieved an haemoglobin A concentration of greater than 50%.
 A live infant was delivered and a suprarenal phaeochromocytoma was excised during a 6.5 hour procedure.
 The patient's postoperative recovery was uneventful.
